intro: Alchornea verrucosa, commonly known as the roughleaf alchornea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Alchornea verrucosa is also valued for its role in ecological systems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
